item.title: As Coronavirus Cases Fall, Countries Struggle to Measure When It's Safe to Reopen
item.description: As the pace of new coronavirus infections slows across Europe, governments are reconsidering how best to measure the progress of the disease and guide their decisions on loosening lockdowns.

item.title: Soaring Prices, Rotting Crops: Coronavirus Triggers Global Food Crisis
item.description: Processing and transportation breakdowns and panic buying are threatening vulnerable nations. “You can have a food crisis with lots of food. That’s the situation we’re in,” said a senior economist at the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations.

item.title: U.S.: Chinese, Iranian Hackers Seek to Steal Virus Research
item.description: Hackers are targeting U.S. universities and health-care firms in a bid to steal intellectual property related to coronavirus treatments and vaccines, and the intrusions may be jeopardizing the medical research, U.S. officials said.

item.title: Britain Starts Easing Lockdown as Pressure Builds on Boris Johnson
item.description: The U.K. took its first steps to ease its lockdown as new figures showed the effects of the coronavirus on its economy, while Prime Minister Boris Johnson faced growing political pressure over his government’s handling of the crisis.

item.title: U.S. Warships Support Malaysia Against China Pressure in South China Sea
item.description: The U.S. has sent three naval ships on patrols near oil-and-gas operations off Malaysia’s coast in recent days, a show of support for the Southeast Asian nation whose offshore explorations in the South China Sea have faced pressure from China.

item.title: China's Wuhan Revs Up Testing Amid Second-Wave Coronavirus Fears
item.description: Covid-19 cases reappear in the Chinese city where the global outbreak began, triggering government demands for a blanket-testing.
